content.description: Climb the middle face on the right side of the "Buffalo Block" via nice crimps.  Fun line and a good warm up for the "Buffalo."
content.location: The approach is the same as The Land of The Slabs.  Take the Sisters trail past "Supper Slab A.K.A. Slim Jim" for about 20-30 yards.  Then head up hill (EAST) or right into the woods for about 20-30 more yards.  This should land you in the general area.  You will know it when you see it!!

content.description: Climb the face right of "Walking Sleep."  It's the farthest-right face on the right side of the "Buffalo Block."
content.location: The approach is the same as The Land of The Slabs.  Take the Sisters trail past "Supper Slab A.K.A. Slim Jim" for about 20-30 yards.  Then head up hill (EAST) or right into the woods for about 20-30 more yards.  This should land you in the general area.  You will know it when you see it!!

content.description: Start (S.D.S.) low on the right most prow of the prominent bulge of the "Buffalo Block."  Climb up and left using a small horizontal seam and slopers.  The far left side jugs of the block are obviously not on.  Short and stout!!!
content.location: The approach is the same as The Land of The Slabs.  Take the Sisters trail past "Supper Slab A.K.A. Slim Jim" for about 20-30 yards.  Then head up hill (EAST) or right into the woods for about 20-30 more yards.  This should land you in the general area.  You will know it when you see it!!
